com.clarionmedia.infinitum.web.rest.impl

Class SharedSecretAuthentication

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.clarionmedia.infinitum.web.rest.impl.SharedSecretAuthentication
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AuthenticationStrategy

    public class SharedSecretAuthentication
extends java.lang.Object
implements AuthenticationStrategy

    Used for token-based/shared-secret authentication. A TokenGenerator can be supplied to this class in order to implement a token-generation policy.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0 03/21/12
    Author:
    Tyler Treat

    • Method Detail

      • authenticate

        public void authenticate(org.apache.http.impl.client.RequestWrapper request)
        Description copied from interface: AuthenticationStrategy
        Adds the necessary authentication information to the given RequestWrapper.
        Specified by:
        authenticate in interface AuthenticationStrategy
        Parameters:
        request - the request to authenticate

      • isHeader

        public boolean isHeader()
        Indicates whether or not request authentication is included as a header. If not a header, it is included as a query string parameter.
        Returns:
        true if it's a header, false if not

      • setHeader

        public void setHeader(boolean isHeader)
        Sets the value indicating whether or not request authentication is included as a header. If not a header, it is included as a query string parameter.
        Parameters:
        isHeader - value to set

      • setTokenName

        public void setTokenName(java.lang.String tokenName)
        Sets the token name. This value represents either the header name or the query string parameter name, depending on what form of authentication is used.
        Parameters:
        tokenName - the token name to use for authentication

      • getTokenName

        public java.lang.String getTokenName()
        Returns the token name. This value represents either the header name or the query string parameter name, depending on what form of authentication is used.

      • setToken

        public void setToken(java.lang.String token)
        Sets the token value. This value represents the header value or the query string parameter value, depending on what form of authentication is used.
        Parameters:
        token - the shared secret to use for authentication

      • getToken

        public java.lang.String getToken()
        Returns the token value. This value represents the header value or the query string parameter value, depending on what form of authentication is used. This is either the value provided to setToken(String) or the value generated from the TokenGenerator if one has been provided.
        Returns:
        shared secret

      • setTokenGenerator

        public void setTokenGenerator(TokenGenerator generator)
        Registers a TokenGenerator for this SharedSecretAuthentication strategy. The TokenGenerator is responsible for creating shared secrets.
        Parameters:
        generator - the TokenGenerator to register

      • clearTokenGenerator

        public void clearTokenGenerator()
        Removes any registered TokenGenerator from this SharedSecretAuthentication strategy.
